citation.article-title: Characterization of N2O-producing Xanthomonas-like isolates from biofilters as Stenotrophomonas nitritireducens sp. nov., Luteimonas mephitis gen. nov., sp. nov. and Pseudoxanthomonas broegbernensis gen. nov., sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Luteimonas (Lu.te.i.mo'nas. M.L. adj. luteus yellow; Gr. n. monas a unit; M.L. fem. n. Luteimonas a yellow unit)
The quinone type is Q-8, fatty acids are of the iso/anteiso-type with 15:0 iso predominating.
The strains have a yellow colour on trypticase soy agar and nutrient agar.
The type species is Luteimonas mephitis.
